nodes.bodyText:
what about read?  indices:data/read*
Can't we deny all using indices:data/* and indices:admin/*  and cluster:admin/snapshot/restore* ?
System indices should not be accessed directly for any actions for nonAdminDN  (Super admin).

Followed below 3 links
https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/security/pull/126#discussion_r320539005
https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/security/pull/126#discussion_r320539568
https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/security/blob/d62ac5334609ea92b913caa5e73917efb8b29043/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/security/privileges/OpenDistroSecurityIndexAccessEvaluator.java#L71-L82
OpenDistroSecurityIndexSearcherWrapper blocks indices:data/write*. indices:data/read* is blocked here in OpenDistroSystemIndexAccessEvaluator.
On indices:admin/*, I tried to make this behavior is same as security index. (OpenDistroSecurityIndexAccessEvaluator).
Had a offline discussion with @hardik-k-shah and we decided to merge class logic into OpenDistroSecurityIndexAccessEvaluator. And remove OpenDistroSystemIndexAccessEvaluator class completely.
Can you cover this in UT?

Good point. "_all" is currently caught by OpenDistroSecurityIndexAccessEvaluator. I don't see a case (with _all) which will pass OpenDistroSecurityIndexAccessEvaluator and reaches here. I am tending to remove this check with isLocalAll(). What do you think?
Can we explore combining condition check on line#71 and line#78?

why are we allowing admin to search system indices?
System indices will be accessible through es APIs only for AdminDN.  All the other user including admin will be able to access index only through APIs defined by respective plugin.

No, we are not allowing admin to search system indices. admin requests return 200 but with empty results. This is same behavior as security index. This allows _all\_search request work, but filters results from system indices.
Thanks for clarifying!
